content.rendered:
Specialty Networks division

Manuel Peltier, born in 1969, holds engineering degrees from the Ecole Polytechnique and the Ecole Nationale des Ponts et Chaussées. He began his career at Freyssinet in 1995, where he first worked on cable-stayed bridge projects in Hong Kong and the United States.

He subsequently headed a number of projects – the Millau bridge, the Dubai metro viaduct and the Sungai Prai viaduct in Malaysia – for the company. He became head of Freyssinet’s Major Projects division in 2008.

Manuel Peltier was appointed Deputy CEO of Freyssinet in July 2012 and CEO in April 2014, before being appointed Chairman of Soletanche Freyssinet in 2016.

As of February 2021, Manuel Peltier heads the Specialty Networks division within the VINCI Construction pole.

excerpt.rendered: As of February 2021, Manuel Peltier heads the Specialty Networks division within VINCI Construction.
